intro: Eremostachys azerbaijanica, commonly known as the Azerbaijani eremostachys, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Azerbaijan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky and dry habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. Its slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers are typical of the genus Eremostachys. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
